sn9.1:3.1: This verse is particularly tricky; see Bodhi’s note in Connected Discourses for discussion and other interpretations. | Pajahāsi and bhavāsi are reflexive second person singular imperative (= pajaha, bhava).
sn9.1:3.2: Sārayāmase is reflexive first person plural imperative causative (= sārayāma). The deity is using the “royal we”. | I take taṁ as accusative (“you”) and sataṁ as accusative of purpose (“for the purpose of being mindful”).
